meta.reference: Schiffman E, Ohrbach R, et al. (2014). Diagnostic Criteria for Temporomandibular Disorders (DC/TMD). Journal of Oral & Facial Pain and Headache 28:6-27.

computed_fields.description: Fields automatically calculated from captured data

properties.id: Unique identifier for the computed field
properties.label: Human-readable name
properties.formula: Expression to calculate the value (JavaScript-like syntax)
properties.formula_simplified: Plain English description of the formula
properties.description: Detailed explanation of what this field represents
properties.dependencies: List of fields required for calculation (format: StepID.field_id)

validation_rules.description: Rules to validate data consistency and flag potential issues

properties.rule: Boolean expression that should evaluate to true
properties.severity: error (blocks progress), warning (requires confirmation), info (notification only)
properties.message: Message to display when rule fails (supports {field_id} placeholders)

routine_chain.description: Sequence of reusable routines to execute in order

form_schema.description: External file containing the DC/TMD Examination Form field schema

supplemental.description: Posterior, submandibular, lateral pterygoid, temporalis tendon

anatomical_regions.label: Other Masticatory Muscles
anatomical_regions.description: Intraoral masticatory muscles: lateral pterygoid area, temporalis tendon

opening_patterns.label: Corrected Deviation
opening_patterns.description: S- or C-curve, deviation >= 2mm that returns to midline

opening_patterns.label: Uncorrected Deviation (Right)
opening_patterns.description: Lateral deviation >= 2mm to right, does not return

opening_patterns.label: Uncorrected Deviation (Left)
opening_patterns.description: Lateral deviation >= 2mm to left, does not return

steps.verbal_command: Did you feel pain with that movement?
Could you point with your finger to each of the areas where you felt pain?
steps.examiner_action: Confirm anatomical structure(s) by touching indicated area(s)

steps.verbal_command: Are there any other areas where you felt pain with that movement? Point [with your finger] to those areas.
Did you feel pain [in the area where I applied pressure]?
Is this pain familiar to any pain you have experienced in this area in the last 30 days?
What is this pain familiar to?
steps.note: Typical response: 'the pain I am complaining about'. Can be omitted after established.

steps.verbal_command: Is this pain familiar to your headache in this area, in the last 30 days?
Did you feel the pain just under my finger, or did you also feel it somewhere else [in different areas of your head, face or jaw]?
[Show me where you felt the pain.] Point with your finger to each of the areas where you just felt pain [in response to my pressure].
Did you feel it anywhere else?

examination_sequence.name: Examiner Confirmation of Pain and Headache Locations

verbal_commands.text: Before I start the exam, I want to review a few things with you.
I will be asking you about pain, and only you know if you have pain. When I ask about pain, I want you to say either yes or no; if you are not sure, give me your best answer.
If you feel pain, I will also ask if that pain is familiar. Familiar pain refers to pain that is similar or like the pain you may have had in that same part of your body in the last 30 days.
If you feel pain in the temple area, I will ask if that pain is like any headache you may have had in the temple area in the last 30 days.
For the purposes of this examination, I am interested in pain that you may have in these areas….
…. and also inside the mouth.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Touch bilaterally the overall areas of temporalis, masseter, TMJ, and posterior mandibular and submandibular muscle areas.

verbal_commands.text: In the last 30 days, have you had pain in these areas [that I touched]?
Could you point with your finger to each of the areas where you have felt pain [in the last 30 days]?
Are there any other areas where you have felt pain [in the last 30 days]?

instructions.examiner_procedure: Touch reported area(s) to confirm pain is in masticatory structure(s).

verbal_commands.text: In the last 30 days, have you had any headaches?
Could you point with your finger to each of the areas where you have felt headache [in the last 30 days]?
Are there other areas where you have felt headache [in the last 30 days]?

instructions.examiner_procedure: Touch reported area(s) to confirm headache location(s).

verbal_commands.text: I will place some pencil marks on your teeth; I will remove them at the end of the examination.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Select right or left pair of maxillary and mandibular central incisors. Use same teeth for all subsequent measurements.

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together.

instructions.examiner_procedure: With pencil, mark horizontal reference line where incisal edge of maxillary reference tooth overlaps opposing mandibular incisor.
Assess maxillary and mandibular dental midlines. If < 1mm discrepancy, no action needed. If >= 1mm, mark vertical line from maxillary to mandibular reference tooth.

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure distance from labial surface of maxillary central incisor to labial surface of opposing mandibular incisor on horizontal plane.
Measure distance that maxillary tooth overlaps mandibular tooth.

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together.
I would like you to slowly open your mouth as wide as you can, even if it is painful, close, and put your back teeth completely together again.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Observe opening pattern. Repeat 2 more times.

verbal_commands.text: I would like you to open your mouth as wide as you can without feeling any pain, or without increasing any pain you may have right now.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure interincisal distance between maxillary and mandibular reference teeth.

verbal_commands.text: I would like you to open your mouth as wide as you can, even if it is painful.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure interincisal distance between maxillary and mandibular reference teeth.

post_procedure.verbal_command: Did you feel any pain with this movement?

verbal_commands.text: In a moment I will try, [if possible], to open your mouth wider with my fingers. If you want me to stop, raise your hand and I will stop immediately.
Now open [your mouth] as wide as you can, even if painful, just as you did before.
Please relax your jaw so I can help you open wider, if possible.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place thumb on maxillary central incisors, index finger on mandibular central incisors (scissors position). Using moderate pressure, stretch mouth open further. Measure interincisal distance.

post_procedure.verbal_command: Did you feel any pain when I tried to open your mouth wider with my fingers?

instructions.examiner_procedure: Record whether patient raised hand to terminate assisted opening.

computed_fields.label: Total Pain Free Opening
computed_fields.description: Sum of vertical incisal overlap and measured pain-free opening

computed_fields.label: Total Maximum Unassisted Opening
computed_fields.description: Sum of vertical incisal overlap and measured maximum unassisted opening

computed_fields.label: Total Maximum Assisted Opening
computed_fields.description: Sum of vertical incisal overlap and measured maximum assisted opening

validation_rules.description: Maximum assisted opening must be greater than or equal to maximum unassisted opening
validation_rules.message: Maximum assisted opening ({max_assisted_opening_mm}mm) cannot be less than maximum unassisted opening ({max_unassisted_opening_mm}mm)

validation_rules.description: Maximum unassisted opening should typically be greater than or equal to pain-free opening
validation_rules.message: Maximum unassisted opening ({max_unassisted_opening_mm}mm) is less than pain-free opening ({pain_free_opening_mm}mm) - please verify

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly, and move your jaw as far as you can to the right, even if it is painful.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure from maxillary reference midline to mandibular reference midline.

post_procedure.verbal_command: Did you feel any pain with that movement?

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly, and move your jaw as far as you can to the left, even if it is painful.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure from maxillary reference midline to mandibular reference midline.

post_procedure.verbal_command: Did you feel any pain with that movement?

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly, and move your jaw forward as far as you can, even if it is painful.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Measure from buccal surface of mandibular tooth to buccal surface of maxillary tooth.

post_procedure.verbal_command: Did you feel any pain with that movement?

computed_fields.label: Adjusted Right Lateral Excursion
computed_fields.formula: midline_discrepancy_mm == 0 ? right_lateral_mm : (midline_deviation_side == 'right' ? right_lateral_mm - midline_discrepancy_mm : right_lateral_mm + midline_discrepancy_mm)
computed_fields.description: Right lateral measurement adjusted for any midline discrepancy. Add discrepancy if midline deviates left; subtract if midline deviates right.
computed_fields.note: If midlines are coincident (<1mm), no adjustment needed

computed_fields.label: Adjusted Left Lateral Excursion
computed_fields.formula: midline_discrepancy_mm == 0 ? left_lateral_mm : (midline_deviation_side == 'left' ? left_lateral_mm - midline_discrepancy_mm : left_lateral_mm + midline_discrepancy_mm)
computed_fields.description: Left lateral measurement adjusted for any midline discrepancy. Add discrepancy if midline deviates right; subtract if midline deviates left.
computed_fields.note: If midlines are coincident (<1mm), no adjustment needed

computed_fields.label: Total Protrusion
computed_fields.description: Sum of horizontal incisal overjet and measured protrusive movement

computed_fields.label: Total Lateral Range of Motion
computed_fields.description: Sum of adjusted right and left lateral excursions

validation_rules.description: Large asymmetry between right and left lateral excursions may indicate pathology
validation_rules.message: Lateral excursion asymmetry detected: Right={adjusted_right_lateral_mm}mm, Left={adjusted_left_lateral_mm}mm (difference > 4mm)

examination_sequence.name: TMJ Noises During Open and Close Movements

verbal_commands.text: I will be evaluating the jaw joints for whether they make any noises. I would like you to pay attention as well, since I will ask you at the end whether you heard or felt any noises.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place fingers over the TMJ(s).

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together.
Slowly open as wide as you can, even if it is painful, and then slowly close until your back teeth are completely together again.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Record noise as click or crepitus if present on at least 1 of 3 movements. Multiple types can be present.

verbal_commands.text: Did you hear or feel noises in either jaw joint when you opened or closed?
Did you feel any pain when that click occurred?

examination_sequence.name: TMJ Noises During Lateral and Protrusive Movements

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together, open slightly, and move your jaw to the right as far as you can, even if painful; move your jaw back and place your back teeth completely together.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place fingers over TMJ(s). Repeat 2 more times.

verbal_commands.text: Place your back teeth completely together, open slightly, and move your jaw to the left as far as you can, even if painful; move your jaw back and place your back teeth completely together.
Place your back teeth completely together, open slightly, and move your jaw forward as far as you can, even if painful; move your jaw back, and place your back teeth completely together.
Did you hear or feel any noises in this [right, left] joint when you moved your jaw forward or to the side?
Did you feel any pain when that click occurred?

examination_sequence.name: Joint Locking
examination_sequence.note: Assessed throughout examination, recorded if observed

verbal_commands.text: Can you "unlock" your jaw?

instructions.examiner_procedure: Inability to further open from partially opened position, even momentarily, is positive.

verbal_commands.text: Can you "unlock" your jaw?

instructions.examiner_procedure: Inability to close from wide-open position, even momentarily, is positive.

examination_sequence.name: Muscle and TMJ Pain with Palpation

verbal_commands.text: Now I am going to apply pressure to different areas of your head, face and jaw, and I will ask you about pain, familiar pain, and familiar headache.
In addition, I will ask whether the pain stays only under my finger or if you feel it also anywhere else besides under my finger.
Each time, I will apply pressure and hold it for 5 seconds.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Calibrate finger pressure to 1.0 kg using algometer.
Palpate temporalis muscle using three vertical bands: anterior, middle, posterior. Cover entire muscle including tendonous attachments.
Palpate masseter muscle using three horizontal bands: origin, body, insertion.
Calibrate finger pressure to 0.5 kg using algometer.

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly, and move your lower jaw forward and then move it back to its normal position with your teeth slightly apart.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place index finger anterior to tragus of ear over lateral pole. Apply 0.5 kg pressure.
Calibrate finger pressure to 1.0 kg using algometer.

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly, and move your lower jaw forward a little bit and keep it there.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place fingertip over lateral pole. Roll finger around lateral pole of condyle in orbital motion while maintaining contact. Apply 1.0 kg pressure.
Calibrate finger pressure to 0.5 kg using algometer.

verbal_commands.text: Relax your jaw.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Palpate area between SCM insertion and posterior border of mandible.

verbal_commands.text: Relax your jaw.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Palpate area 2 cm anterior to angle of mandible, medial to mandible.

verbal_commands.text: Open slightly and move your jaw to the side.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place finger on buccal side of alveolar ridge above maxillary molars, move posteriorly, medially, and upward as far as possible.

verbal_commands.text: Open your mouth.

instructions.examiner_procedure: Place finger on anterior ridge of coronoid process. Palpate superior aspect.
Record any pertinent findings not included above.
